intro: Beckera gracilis, commonly known as the slender beckera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters. Beckera gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
